intro: Heterotheca scabrella, commonly known as the roughleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and roadsides. Its leaves are covered in fine, rough hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Heterotheca scabrella produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators.
